title: PHPftp_systype()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPftp_systype()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
// connect and login to FTP server
$ftp_server = "ftp.example.com";
$ftp_conn = ftp_connect($ftp_server) or die("Could not connect to $ftp_server");
$login = ftp_login($ftp_conn, $ftp_username, $ftp_userpass);
// get system type
if ($type = ftp_systype($ftp_conn))
{
echo "System type is: $type";
}
else
{
echo "Could not get system type.";
}
// close connection
ftp_close($ftp_conn);
?>

practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
// connect and login to FTP server
$ftp_server = "ftp.example.com";
$ftp_conn = ftp_connect($ftp_server) or die("Could not connect to $ftp_server");
$login = ftp_login($ftp_conn, $ftp_username, $ftp_userpass);
// get system type
if ($type = ftp_systype($ftp_conn))
{
echo "System type is: $type";
}
else
{
echo "Could not get system type.";
}
// close connection
ftp_close($ftp_conn);
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPftp_systype()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPftp_systype()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPftp_systype()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
